name: Holiday Inn Express Louisville Northeast

reviews.text: Please read all of this..I know it's long, but believe me, its worth the read.
reviews.title: And to top it all off, they charged us for the LIGHTBULBS! Horrible hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We drove 5 hours from the Chicagoland area to visit some relatives. It was me, my boyfriend and his two children. Upon our arrival to the hotel, everything seemed fine. As we checked in, my boyfriend confirmed the rate we were being charged since we went through AAA and were receiving a discount. They assured us of the price and so we checked in. The room was nice, a suite with a pull out couch, tv, microwave, and fridge. We had the kids wash their hands in the sink outside the bathroom. As I was looking around I happened to open the cabinet below that sink and discovered that it was leaking. We called the front desk and they came up and fixed the pipe that had the leak. We decided, to be safe, to not use that sink for the remainder of the stay. As they fixed the pipe we tried to turn on the lights in the room. When the lights wouldn't turn on we checked and realized that none of the lamps had bulbs. Unfortunately as we were checking, one of the kids accidentally stuck his finger into the bulb socket and was shocked. We told the owner of the hotel and he said they would return with some light bulbs. They came back with the bulbs and we resumed settling into the room. We went and visited my boyfriends cousins for a few hours and upon our return he asked the front desk if it would be ok for them to come visit so the kids could swim in the pool. They said that would be fine so we called them and went swimming. The kids got about an hour of swimming in when a man working at the hotel approached us and said the pool would be closing an hour early because they were going to paint the floor. By then it was already close to the new closing time so we got the kids out and left the pool. After they left I sent my boyfriend down to get some extra towels since there were only 3 and there were 4 of us. When he came back he informed me that the pool wasn't closed like they said it would be and that he was told it was a bridal party. So basically we were kicked out because a bridal party didn't want to share. And when he went to the desk later on that night to tell them, the denied it being open...while the bridal party was still in the pool. He said "go look, there's people swimming right now", to which they replied "no, the pool is closed. they're painting the floor". So they had six year olds painting the floor?? We decided it wasn't worth it since we were tired from the drive as it was and got ready for bed. When we tried to get the bed out of the pull out couch, it was stuck. Someone came to the room to try to help, but they couldnt get the bed out either. So they had to bring a cot to our room for the kids to sleep on. The next morning my boyfriend and the kids went to get breakfast in the lobby, if you can call watery imitation eggs and questionable meats, and something they tried to pass as gravy, breakfast. I am in no way at all a picky eater but even I decided to opt for the instant oatmeal. We finally checked out and made the 5 hour drive back home. You'd think the drama would end there, but it didn't. Upon checking his account, my boyfriend discovered that we were charged more than they said for the room. He was fed up with the hotel by then and so he called corporate and told them what happened. They apologized and said they would send us a $50 gift card an an incentive to continue business with them. They also said to call the manager of the hotel because they should have given us that night free. He called the manager after that and told him what corporate said, to which the manager told him that they were not giving him any of the money back because he was getting a gift card. He told them that he was given the card so they could keep his business and that they said he shouldn't have to pay for the night at all but he just wanted the overcharge back. They told him again that they weren't giving him anything. He reminded them that his son was shocked in their room on their property and they said to him "it wasn't a big deal" and that they still weren't refunding him. He told the manager that we would be taking the necessary steps to let others know how they handle business and that he would in turn lose business to which they said "do what you have to do". He called corporate back, told them what happened, and asked if they could look up what the charge was for. When they looked it up they told him we were charged for the LIGHTBULBS they brought to the room. Lightbulbs that should have been there in the first place. They actually charged us for them! Needless to say corporate decided to refund us everything, the room, tax....the bulbs. This would never had been such a huge problem if the hotel owner wasn't such an A-hole. We never asked for the night refunded, we just wanted what we were overcharged back. And since the owner purchased into the franchise, corporate said they cant do anything, even though initially they told us they would refund it all.
reviews.title: Trying unsuccessfully to compete with Hampton Inns

reviews.text: We ended up at this hotel through a Hotwire purchase when we planned a last minute trip to the KY Derby, and every place within a 50 mile radius of Louisville is gouging you for a room. Our place seemed to be a deal relatively speaking, but it was still way, way overpriced due to the Derby. The hotel was conveniently located near the freeway in a suburban area, that was the best thing about it. The hotel seems newer, or that attempts to update it have been made, but it really shows hard wear and tear. The bad: there was a reddish fruit punch colored stain on the carpet in our room outside the bathroom area. The arms of the desk chair looked like they had been chewed by an animal or a hungry teething child. I take longer showers, and by the time I finished mine and my husband took his the water was lukewarm, not hot. One of the electrical outlets in the room didn't work. We thought the iron was not working until we plugged it in a different outlet and saw that the problem was not the iron itself. There was a man an a woman outside yelling in the middle of our second night who woke both me and my husband up. When we checked out there was trash strewn outside near the entry (paper plates, bottled water packaging). The good: beds were OK, the shower enclosure was newer so taking a shower didn't gross me out, nice large plasma TV, toiletries were decent, mini fridge in the room was super cold and nice to have for holding some drinks. In summary, I wouldn't be afraid to stay here again if it was my only choice, but I'd certainly take time to look for a nearby Hampton Inn instead because for that category/price point of room I think Hampton generally executes a much better experience.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.text: only one small problem, a lightbulb was missing from night stand lamp.
reviews.title: Not a recommendation

reviews.text: When we arrived today, we were offered great service and offered a floor of our choice. When we walked into our room, as usual our family was dazzled, but as we stayed, we realized the place wasn't that great. At our table that I am sitting at now writing this review, both the chairs right handle were both broken, a chair that was supposed to be in the corner wasn't there, and the TV has to have it's volume adjusted every time you turn it on (which is hard when you have one family member who never lets you watch the TV.) Although they have high-speed internet and great service, I would not recommend this hotel very much, although I would still come even if it was the last hotel on Earth.
reviews.title: Rude General Manager, poor plumbing
Caution, Do Not Stay
reviews.text: Be aware, hotel management is unethical and unprofessional. Charge in full for 13 rooms for 2 nights for an athletic event that was canceled due to 10 inches of snow. Lied about event not being canceled and other teams staying at property. Spoke to other Holiday Inn properties about their policies and everyone refunded or did not charge for teams that canceled due to weather. Management was very rude, unethical and unprofessional.

likes.liked: — Comfort of the room (4 pillows per bed with a comfortable mattress).

reviews.text: Everything was nice about this property. The room was clean, the breakfast was good (minus the dry biscuits), the pool was clean, and the employees were nice. When I booked my room, it didn't mention the refrigerator or microwave so that was a pleasant surprise. I recommend this to others!
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, But High Room-To-Room Noise Transfer

reviews.text: Great location for shopping and restaurants in the area are plentiful. The facility is clean, well appointed, and the property is very well maintained. The staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfasts are great and the cinnamon rolls are just the best. The decor in the rooms is contemporary and very attractive. The king bed is huge and comfortable, though the plastic-backed mattress cover makes an odd crunching noise when you move around in bed. Nice big bathroom, good showerhead, and the curved shower curtain rod provides unmatched shoulder room.
reviews.title: Great Locale
Holdiay Inn Express _Chamberlain Lane
reviews.text: But if you have anyone in the rooms adjacent to you, forget about your privacy and good luck getting a good night's sleep. Telephone conversations might as well be on a party line and television viewing in the adjacent rooms is evident, even at reduced volumes. I'd go back only with a guarantee that no one would be in the rooms next to me.

Clean and comfortable rooms and common areas look like they have been recently renovated (new carpeting). Breakfast area was well cared for and stocked by pleasant woman. Exercise room needed some attention as several machines were not in working order and water had run out but pool area seemed clean and plenty of towels. Newer tv and looked like tub area was new. Towels were actually "fluffy"! Neaby shopping area provided alot of food options for dinner.
reviews.title: Nice stay for the night

reviews.text: It is not often that a hotel treats everyone with such respect and kindness. Everyone from the front desk to the cleaning staff was nothing but kind, friendly, and respectful to all my girls and their families!
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: Beauty Queens can be somewhat little divas. We are messy, and can forget to take care of our surroundings. Your crew just did the job for us! Thank you on behalf of my staff and the 2012 Mrs Kentucky Delegates!
reviews.title: GREAT STAY!
Another great Holiday Inn Express experience and it was as good as the others
Under NO circumstances would I book with this hotel

aka: Holiday Inn Express Louisville i-265 East Hotel Louisville
description: Holiday Inn Express Louisville East is located off of I-265 exit-32, on Chamberlain Lane & Westport Road interchange, where our guests find Consistent Quality Service. We offer complimentary Deluxe Continental Breakfast with Hot Items, Heated Indoor Pool, Whirlpool, Fitness Center, Meeting facility up to 40 people. Convenient access to Ford Plant, local shopping, dining, area businesses & Churchill Downs, home of the Kentucky Derby.With our 100% satisfaction guarantee & Priority Club Rewards, is the right hotel for all your business & leisure needs. We are just minutes from Downtown Louisville, 4th Street Live, HorseShoe Riverboat Casino, Kentucky Fair and Exposition Center, Cardinal Stadium, University of Louisville Campus, E. P. Tom Sawyer Park, Six Flags Kentucky Kingdom, and Louisville International Airport, Airport Code SDF. Whether in town for business or pleasure we can meet and exceed your needs. With our central convenient location, your just minutes from restaurants and entertainment. We offer Complimentary High Speed Wired & Wireless Internet Access in Rooms, Lobby, Meeting Room, Breakfast Area & Business Center.
